questions.question: The First Amendment provides protection for freedom of speech.
Anonymity means revealing one's identity online.
Net Neutrality refers to regulations that ensure fair access to the internet.
Posting sensitive material online is always allowed without consequences.
The Global Net is free from censorship and political influence.
Print media includes newspapers, magazines, and books.
Broadcast media includes telephones and postal systems.
Common carriers include telephones and the postal system.
The Telecommunication Act of 1996 removed restrictions on services that telephone companies can provide.
The Telecommunication Act of 1996 introduced artificial legal divisions of service areas.
No provider or user of interactive computer services shall be treated as a publisher of any information provided by another information-content provider.
The Communications Decency Act of 1996 was the first major Internet censorship law.
All parts of the Communications Decency Act of 1996 were ruled constitutional.
Is the restriction on free speech applied to both government and private businesses equally?
Anonymous speech is protected.
Some restrictions are allowed on advertising.
Libel and direct, specific threats are protected.
Inciting violence is legal.
Most efforts to censor the Internet focus on pornographic and other sexually explicit material.
Obscenity depicts acts in a manner that appeals to prurient interest as judged by a reasonable person using community standards.
Obscenity lacks literary, artistic, or social value.
Advocating illegal acts is usually legal.
Laws must chill expression of legal speech.
Adults should be reduced to reading only what is fit for children.
The Child Online Protection Act of 1998 (COPA) was more limited than the Communications Decency Act (CDA).
COPA made it a federal crime for commercial websites to make material harmful to minors available, as judged by community standards.
The Children's Internet Protection Act of 2000 (CIPA) requires schools and libraries to install filtering software.
A California law banning the sale or rental of violent video games to minors was upheld by the Supreme Court of California in 2011.
A law in California banned the sale or rental of violent video games to minors.
In 2011, the Supreme Court ruled that the California law violated the Second Amendment.
Filters are an alternative to censorship that block sites with specific words, phrases, or images.
Parental control filters are updated frequently but may still screen out too much or too little.
It is possible to eliminate all unwanted content using filters.
Commercial services, online communities, and social networking sites develop policies to protect members.
The video game industry developed a rating system that provides an indication for parents about the amount of profanity and violence in a game.
Congress extended the law against child pornography.
Did the law include virtual child pornography?
Did the Court reject the later law providing harsh penalties for computer-generated and cartoon-type images?
Is spam mostly commercial advertisement?
Does spam violate free speech issues?
Spam filters violate free speech.
Anti-spam laws target commercial spam.
Anti-spam laws have been criticized for banning all spam.
Spam filters are designed to control the assault of non-solicited pornography and marketing.
WikiLeaks is an example of a website that leaks sensitive material.
Climategate is unrelated to leaks of sensitive information.
Releasing a large number of documents can be potentially dangerous.
Web site operators have no responsibilities regarding leaks.
Anonymity can be used to protect criminal and antisocial activities.
Anonymity on the Internet protects criminal and anti-social activities.
Anonymity aids in fraud, harassment, extortion, distribution of child pornography, theft, and copyright infringement.
Anonymity masks illegal surveillance by government agencies.
Anonymity is never appropriate on the Internet.
Should laws forbid anonymity on the Internet?
Do some countries block specific sites and content at the border?
Is anonymity always allowed on the Internet?
Do all countries ban certain types of access to the Internet?
Are attempts to limit the flow of information on the Internet new?
The global nature of the Net allows restrictions in one country to be avoided by using networks in other, less restrictive countries.
The global nature of the Net makes it harder for one nation to execute restrictive standards on others.
The global nature of the Net facilitates one nation imposing restrictive standards on others.
The global net has an impact on free speech.
Free speech in 'free countries' does not impact more restrictive countries.
